title: The Root Schema
description: The hemtt.json or hemtt.toml file is used to configure your HEMTT Project. All examples are done using JSON, but both files support every feature of HEMTT. hemtt.toml will be used if both files are present.

prefix.title: The Prefix Schema
prefix.description: Prefix used for CBA macros and the release directory name.

version.title: The Version Schema
version.description: HEMTT will look for ```addons/main/script_version.hpp``` and use it for the version number. If you are not using the CBA project structure or do not have that file you can add a version number in the HEMTT project file.

files.title: The Files Schema
files.description: HEMTT will copy the files to the release directory after a successful release build. Supports glob patterns.

include.title: The Include Schema
include.description: HEMTT will include matching relative or absolute paths when building.

exclude.title: The Exclude Schema
exclude.description: HEMTT will exclude matching files when building.

optionals.title: The Optionals Schema
optionals.description: HEMTT will build the specified addons from the ./optionals folder.

folder_optionals.title: The Folder_optionals Schema
folder_optionals.description: HEMTT will by default build optionals into their own mod folders, which can be directly launched by the user. This can be turned off to build optional PBOs directly into optionals folder.

skip.title: The Skip Schema
skip.description: HEMTT will skip building the specified addons.

headerexts.title: The Headerexts Schema
headerexts.description: HEMTT will apply specified header extensions to each PBO. Supports templating.

modname.title: The Modname Schema
modname.description: HEMTT will use the specified mod name (without @) to form @mod folder. Supports templating.

keyname.title: The Keyname Schema
keyname.description: HEMTT will use the specified key name for .bikey and .biprivatekey names. Supports templating.

signame.title: The Signame Schema
signame.description: HEMTT will use the specified signature name as part of the full signature (.bisign) name. Supports templating.

sigversion.title: The Sigversion Schema
sigversion.description: HEMTT will use the specified signature version. Currently Supported: V2, V3 (Experiemental).

reuse_private_key.title: The Reuse_private_key Schema
reuse_private_key.description: If set to true, HEMTT will use (and re-use) releases/keys/{keyname}.biprivatekey. It will be generated if it doesn't exist. The default behaviour is to generate a new private key each time and discard it immediately. HEMTT strongly recommends that you only re-use the key if you are making a client-side mod where it will not matter if clients are running different versions of the mod.

steps_linux.title: The Steps_linux Schema
steps_linux.description: steps_windows and steps_linux can be used to run different steps on the respective platforms.

steps_windows.title: The Steps_windows Schema
steps_windows.description: steps_windows and steps_linux can be used to run different steps on the respective platforms.

show_output.title: The Show_output Schema
show_output.description: All output is hidden by default. Setting show_output will display the command being executed and its output.

foreach.title: The Foreach Schema
foreach.description: Scripts can be ran for each addons. Inside prebuild the script will be ran for each addon that HEMTT will build, including addons that will be skipped if they are already built. Inside postbuild and releasebuild only addons that were successfully built with be used, excluding addons that were skipped for being up to date.

parallel.title: The Parallel Schema
parallel.description: Requires foreach to be true. If a script is thread safe parallel can be used to process multiple addons at a time.
